Arjun disease: Prune and burn infected branches, collect and destroy fallen leaves, avoid wounding the trunk, apply copper oxychloride or mancozeb paste on cankers, spray carbendazim or thiophanate-methyl at first sign of leaf spot or dieback.
Arjun healthy: Plant in well-drained soil with full sun, maintain proper spacing for airflow, avoid mechanical injury to trunk and roots, prune only during dry season, remove fallen leaves regularly, apply balanced fertilizer and monitor for early pest/disease symptoms.
